intro: Rabdosia mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-tipped rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. Rabdosia mucronata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
